comment:
* Helps control and display a month view of a calendar that has a current * selected day. *
    *
  • Keeps track of current month, day, year
    • *
  • Keeps track of current cursor position (row, column)
    • *
  • Provides methods to help display the calendar
    • *
  • Provides methods to move the cursor up / down / left / right.
    • *
* * This should be used by anyone who presents a month view to users and wishes * to behave consistently with other widgets and apps; if we ever change our * mind about when to flip the month, we can change it here only. * * @hide

methods.name: public void setSelectedRowColumn(int row, int col)
public int getSelectedMonthOffset()
methods.comment:
* @return 0 if the selection is in the current month, otherwise -1 or +1
     * depending on whether the selection is in the first or last row.

methods.name: public boolean isSelected(int row, int column)
public boolean up()
methods.comment:
* Move up one box, potentially flipping to the previous month.
     * @return Whether the month was flipped to the previous month
     *   due to the move.

methods.name: public boolean down()
methods.comment:
* Move down one box, potentially flipping to the next month.
     * @return Whether the month was flipped to the next month
     *   due to the move.

methods.name: public boolean left()
methods.comment:
* Move left one box, potentially flipping to the previous month.
     * @return Whether the month was flipped to the previous month
     *   due to the move.

methods.name: public boolean right()
methods.comment:
* Move right one box, potentially flipping to the next month.
     * @return Whether the month was flipped to the next month
     *   due to the move.

methodNames: public void setSelectedRowColumn(int row, int col)
public boolean isSelected(int row, int column)
